line.text: My mistress eyes are nothing like the sun
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: Coral is far more red than her lips red
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: If snow be white why then her breasts are dun
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: If hairs be wires black wires grow on her head
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: I have seen roses damasked red and white
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: But no such roses see I in her cheeks
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: And in some perfumes is there more delight
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: Than in the breath that from my mistress reeks
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: I love to hear her speak yet well I know
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: That music hath a far more pleasing sound
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: I grant I never saw a goddess go
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: My mistress when she walks treads on the ground
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: And yet by heaven I think my love as rare
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*

line.text: As any she belied with false compare
line.meter: s s* s s* s s* s s* s s*
